flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

lines.text: For this project, an old 2010 calender with a dimension of 36" x 24" was ideal because the width of the months were wide enough to glue a pocket over to hold the bills.  In this case, the width was about 7 inches.
lines.text_raw: For this project, an old 2010 calender with a dimension of 36" x 24" was ideal because the width of the months were wide enough to glue a pocket over to hold the bills.  In this case, the width was about 7 inches.

lines.text: To make the outline for the pockets, you must first determine the style and shape you want your pockets to be.  For simplicity sake, you can make a simple louver pocket, that is, one that slopes outwards from bottom to top.

guide.summary:
Do you have trouble keeping your utility bills organized?

Well, I'll show you how you can make a smart utility bill holder from old calenders in a few steps.
guide.title: Utility Bill Organizer
